intro: Platynema paniculata, commonly known as the panicled flatstem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its flat, leafy stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela, which are dispersed by wind. Platynema paniculata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
